name: Domaine du Bas Caumont

reviews.text: The welcome from the hostess is insurpassable. This lovely, charming residence is very well located overlooking the Seine. The rooms are well sized and beautifully decorated. I would say that the house has been restored in a loving and careful way. We ate supper there which was lovely after a long day travelling. Isabelle speaks very good english which was helpful. The breakfast was excellent and provided in a beautiful garden room. Our son loved watching the ships go past just across the road. Overall and excellent stay.
reviews.title: Gem of a find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at this delightful B&B on our way from Giverny to the Landing Beaches. A somewhat faded beauty, (slowly and lovingly being restored by the owners) this pretty, tranquil residence with comfortable rooms and beautiful grounds, overlooks the Seine. The generous and delicious breakfasts (shirred eggs, back bacon, fresh pineapple, cheeses, yogurt, croissants and homemade jams, etc.) cooked to perfection by charming owner Isabelle, are served in a sunny breakfast room, on a table laid with white batiste cloths, and French doors open on to the property and the Seine beyond. Good little restaurant "La Gastronomie" in La Bouille (be sure to sample their Normandy cheeses and Tarte Tatin with thick cream), is a pleasant 15 min. walk along the Seine from the B&B. The town is a good base for daytrips to Rouen, Dieppe, Honfleur, Lyons la Foret, etc.
reviews.title: Lovely Normandy introduction 1+1/2 hrs from CdeG airport

description: Bed and Breakfast Domaine du Bas-Caumont is located 5 minutes driving from A.13 and A.28 hightway. Parking secure in the property, 7 restaurauts in La Bouille village (at the end of the road typical Normand village)or fine tray dinner home made (to be booked). Take it easy during holiday, "l'art de vivre à la Française" c'est ici.Rooms overlooking Seine river. Breakfast home made, typically french.
